alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 17 at 5:17PM CDT until May 17 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Decatur County in south central Iowa... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 517 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lamoni, or 12 miles east of Mount Ayr, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Leon, Lamoni, Grand River, Garden Grove, Davis City, Decatur City, Pleasanton, Le Roy, Nine Eagles State Park and Lamoni Municipal Airport. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 2 and 22. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
